data.text:
Popular as The Empress of Pop, Ayumi Hamasaki is a Japanese singer, actress, model, and businesswoman who not only entertained Japan, but became an inspiration to many. What’s significant about Ayumi being one of the greatest Japanese singers of all time is that she failed in almost everything she did, including music, before she finally came to win. its place. Beyond her music and her professional life, here is everything you need to know about her.

Ayumi Hamasaki – Profile and Biography

Popularly known as Ayu, the singer was born on October 2, 1978 in Fukuoka, Japan. Growing up she didn’t have the sweetest life, she was raised mostly by her mother and grandmother, after her father whom she never saw again left the family when She was still just a little girl.

Her situation forced her to grow up fast and by. At the age of only seven, she had started her career as a model in advertising for banks and other institutions. Due to her height, her modeling career ended at the age of 14 following her signing to a talent agency in Tokyo, Japan. This led her to move to a music agency, Sun Music, to try a career in music, but with a failed debut album in 1995, she was let go.

With no modeling career and a failed music career, Ayumi Hamasaki’s next decision will be to become an actress, but after a few productions such as Ladys Ladys!! Soucho Saigo no Hi, Master of Twins, and Sumomo mo Momo, she left the theater because she did not record any success there and her works were poorly accepted.

Ayumi Hamasaki’s failure story is her attempt always failed, but she failed again and then tried to resume her studies after returning to her mother’s house, but she failed again and finally dropped out.

Not yet the one who gave up, she was introduced to Max Matsuura who was a music producer and after hearing her sing at karaoke, he signed her to a contract with the Avex label after being persuaded that he was being honest. Because she kept skipping her singing lessons, feeling it was too rigid, and was sent to the United States to practice. In letters exchanged between her and Matsuura, he told her that she could start writing her own songs, which would have greatly improved her self-esteem.

Her debut single, Poker Face was released in 1998. Although it wasn’t a hit, it was a significant improvement on what she had done and, with each release of her work, she blazed a trail. way into the hearts of fans that when his debut album A Song for × arrived in 1999, it was a hit with one million copies sold. Her next album, Loveppears which was released in the same year was even bigger as it sold 3 million copies.

By the time she released her Made in Japan album in 2016, she had already had 16 more, and had already made one of the best albums the country had ever seen with over a hundred awards, including various awards in Japan. Gold Disc and the MTV World Music Awards.

Family life and husband

Looking at his family life and the men in it, Hamasaki has been married twice. The first man to become her husband was Austrian actor and model, Manuel Schwarz, whom she met in 2010. The two got married in 2011, but the marriage sadly ended in 2012.

A year after her divorce, the Queen of Pop met and started dating Tyson Bodkin. Although 10 years younger than herself, Ayu married Bodkin but, much like her first marriage, it wasn’t to last forever, with the duo not divorcing until two years later.
